70a6e2e6d34fa5a404e88e45cd62a20a06e19556.commitMessage: Issue #2666: Print name of the Check after printing violation message

a29f01a95b9dee1e64ec7ed91b4d0876eb82c0bf.commitMessage: Issue #67: Added support of logging severity for all audit events

ee1b845b7936df396543bc11dced4676d5af86b6.commitMessage:
Remove redundant toString() calls. #1555

Fixes `UnnecessaryToStringCall` inspection violations.

Description:
>Reports on any calls to toString() used in string concatenations and as arguments to the print() and println() methods of java.io.PrintWriter and java.io.PrintStream, the append() method of java.lang.StringBuilder and java.lang.StringBuffer or the trace(), debug(), info(), warn() and error() methods of org.slf4j.Logger. In these cases the conversion to string will be handled by the underlying library methods and an explicit call to toString() is no needed.
 Note that without the toString() call the expression will have slightly different semantics (the string null will be used instead of throwing a NullPointerException).

4d6e2376db89b69167de867bfc28f8d8624a6b78.commitMessage:
Move constants to left side of comparison. #1555

Fixes `ConstantOnLHSOfComparison` inspection violations.

Description:
>Reports on comparison operations with constant values on their left-hand side. Some coding conventions specify that constants should be on the right-hand side of comparisons.

1c42e3eeb9aeebc47b2373541c1cc8d311d8b671.commitMessage: Fix PMD violations from 'strings' ruleset, issue #873

e36ae750f6378b9a3cd8e5171c6e6b710bf10959.commitMessage:
Revert "Added support of logging severity for all audit events, issue #67"

This reverts commit ca3ffb73abc810385a4ce8fe685ad31c9d172bff.

ca3ffb73abc810385a4ce8fe685ad31c9d172bff.commitMessage: Added support of logging severity for all audit events, issue #67

89005ddf6d5d8b494e4451d16df9fd8996c735a9.commitMessage:
Replace calls to equals() on enums with identity comparison

This replacement is safe because two enum constants are equal only when they have the same identity.

ca634f7cafbf0d8f21eac1c4badacbe2f3cf8832.commitMessage:
Replace `StringBuffer` with `StringBuilder` to improve performance

Thread-safety given by `StringBuffer` doesn't give any benefit when used within one method, so in such cases `StringBuilder` is safe and more efficient replacement.

e8a1b54e7935ff07c181f7d2130d55dbb29baddc.commitMessage: behave like gcc when emitting warnings, i.e. prepend "warning: " to the message

53197d9be9366ccf9ebccc1e6e31270c1dff8e95.commitMessage: Patch from David Schneider to add Severity to logged messages.

12e8a3664b264388535070b5b7641f9f469adade.commitMessage:
precalculate the StringBuffer size to avoid calls to expandCapacity
speedup of OpenOrb check by about 2.5%

add2bdfb27494bff5fa9c305d9782f57c6170b18.commitMessage:
fixed bug 561616 (ant task should log errors, not infos)

This required a redesign of the AuditListener interface, the get/setOutputStream methoeds have been removed, as there might be listeners that have no or more than one OutputStream.

The DefaultLogger now differentiates between info messages ("started checking file ...", etc.) and error messages (style errors found by checkstyle) by writing the messages to two different OutputStreams.

6970485b88600343de72af03a6bf87cf78e6cf55.commitMessage:
Started to add support for including the column number in the output. It
really rocks - I wish I had done it from the start!

Strangely, although I am starting to use IDEA a lot for code development, I
still use Emacs for fixing checkstyle errors.

2279ec2a489d1104f2741f2aa3458857d862ac34.commitMessage: Removed a hack of using toString() on AuditEvent in the default logger.
